shapes

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes.Shape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Circle, Rectangle, Triangle

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
    A shape that appears on screen and interacts with other shapes.

    Shapes are the basic building blocks of games built with the Shapes framework. They can be of different colors and sizes, can move around the screen, can collide with one another, and can say things, to name a few.

    You won't use this class directly; you'll use one of its subclasses: Circle, Rectangle or Triangle.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a new shape with default values.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shape

        public Shape()
        Constructs a new shape with default values.

        Overriding constructors should call super() to ensure that Game.addShape() is called, and should call setup().

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public abstract void setup()
        Initializes the Shape. When you subclass shape, you'll override this method to do things like set the shape's color, set its starting position, etc.

      • update

        public abstract void update()
        Updates the shape once per frame. When you subclass shape, you'll override this method to do things like move the shape, change its size, etc.

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(Shape s)
        Checks if this shape contains another given shape.
        Parameters:
        s - the shape that may be contained in this shape.
        Returns:
        true if s is entirely inside this shape, false otherwise.

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(Point p)
        Checks if this shape contains a given point.
        Parameters:
        p - a point to check for inside this shape.
        Returns:
        true if p is inside or on the border of this shape.

        public Game.Border[] touchingBorders()
        TODO Checks which border of the window the shape is touching.
        Returns:
        a Border enum indicating which border if any the shape is touching.

      • isTouching

        public boolean isTouching(Shape s)
        Checks if this shape is touching another shape.
        Parameters:
        s - the shape to check.
        Returns:
        true if this shape is touching s, false otherwise. Returns false if s is null.

        public abstract boolean isOffscreen()
        TODO

      • isTouchingBorder

        public boolean isTouchingBorder()
        Checks if this shape is touching the border of the window.
        Returns:
        true if any part of the shape is touching the border of the window, or if the shape is entirely outside the window, and false otherwise.

      • move

        public void move(double pixels)
        Moves in the shape's direction.

        Moves pixels pixels in the direction set using setDirection(Direction). Won't move through solid shapes, and won't move if direction hasn't been set.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double), setDirection(Direction)

      • move

        public void move(Direction direction,
        double pixels)
        Moves in the given direction.

        Moves pixels pixels in the given direction. Won't move through solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        direction - the direction in which to move. Won't move if null.
        See Also:
        move(double)

      • isClicked

        public boolean isClicked()
        Checks if this shape was clicked since the previous frame. Returns true if:
        • the mouse button was clicked inside this shape since the last frame
        • the mouse was dragged into this shape while the mouse button was down, and is currently inside this shape
        Returns:
        true if this shape was clicked since the previous frame, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Mouse.clickLocation()

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight(double pixels)
        Moves right.

        Moves pixels pixels to the right. Won't move through solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        pixels - the distance to move.
        See Also:
        move(Direction, double)

      • say

        public void say(java.lang.String speech)
        Display text near this shape.

        Continues speaking until this method is called again with new text. Stops speaking if speech is null.

        Parameters:
        speech - what the shape says.
        See Also:
        say(String, int), setSpeechStyle(TextStyle), getSpeech(), isSpeaking()

      • say

        public void say(java.lang.String speech,
       int frames)
        Displays text near this shape for a limited time. Stops speaking if speech is null.
        Parameters:
        speech - what the shape says.
        frames - how long the shape speaks.
        See Also:
        say(String), setSpeechStyle(TextStyle), getSpeech(), isSpeaking()

      • getSpeech

        Returns what this shape is saying.
        Returns:
        what this shape is saying, or null if the shape isn't saying anything.
        See Also:
        say(String, int), say(String)

      • setSpeechStyle

        public void setSpeechStyle(TextStyle speechStyle)
        Sets the visual style of this shape's speech text. The speech's size, font, color and bold/italics can be customized with the passed TextStyle object.
        Parameters:
        speechStyle - the styling of this shape's speech.
        See Also:
        getSpeechStyle()

        See Also:

      • isSpeaking

        Returns:

      • towards

        public Direction towards(Point target)
        Returns the direction of a given point relative to this shape.

        Can be used to move(double) this shape towards a point: this.move(this.towards(targetPoint), 10.0);

        Parameters:
        target - the point to aim towards.
        Returns:
        the direction of target relative to this shape, or null if target is null.
        See Also:
        towards(Shape), move(Direction, double), setDirection(Direction)

      • towards

        public Direction towards(Shape target)
        Returns the direction of a shape relative to this shape.

        Can be used to move(double) this shape towards another shape: this.move(this.towards(targetShape), 10.0);

        Parameters:
        target - the shape to aim towards.
        Returns:
        the direction of target's relative to this shape's center, or null if target is null.
        See Also:
        towards(Point), move(Direction, double), setDirection(Direction)

      • distanceTo

        public double distanceTo(Shape target)
        Returns the distance between this shape and another shape.
        Parameters:
        target - the shape whose distance away to find.
        Returns:
        distance in pixels from this shape to target.

      • distanceTo

        public double distanceTo(Point target)
        Returns the distance between this shape and a point.
        Parameters:
        target - the point whose distance away to find.
        Returns:
        distance in pixels from this shape to target.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys this shape so it will no longer be rendered. Call this method when you have finished using the shape.

        A destroyed shape will not appear on the screen and will not interact with other shapes. A destroyed shape cannot be undestroyed. Continuing to call this shape's methods after it has been destroyed has undefined results.

      • isDestroyed

        public boolean isDestroyed()
        Returns true if this shape has been destroyed.
        Returns:
        true if destroy() has been called on this shape, false otherwise.

      • rotate

        public void rotate(double degrees)
        Rotate this shape's direction. Passing a negative value to degrees causes a clockwise rotation.
        Parameters:
        degrees - the number of degrees by which to rotate.

      • setLayer

        public void setLayer(int layer)
        Set this shape's z-axis layer.

        When two shapes overlap, the one in the higher layer will be displayed on top of the one in the lower layer. All shapes start at layer 0 by default. A shape's layer only affects its appearance--shapes in different layers still interact with one another.

        Parameters:
        layer - layer along the z-axis this shape will be contained in.

      • getLayer

        public int getLayer()
        Get this shape's z-axis layer.

        When two shapes overlap, the one in the higher layer will be displayed on top of the one in the lower layer. All shapes start at layer 0 by default. A shape's layer only affects its appearance--shapes in different layers still interact with one another.

        Returns:
        layer along the z-axis this shape is contained in.

      • setFilled

        public void setFilled(boolean fill)
        Set whether this shape is filled or outlined.

        A filled shape has a colored interior, and a non-filled shape has a colored outline but a transparent interior. Fill affects how the shape appears but not its functionality.

        Parameters:
        fill - true for fill, false for outline.

      • isFilled

        public boolean isFilled()
        Returns whether this shape is filled or outlined.

        A filled shape has a colored interior, and a non-filled shape has a colored outline but a transparent interior. Fill affects how the shape appears but not its functionality.

        Returns:
        true if filled, false if outline.

      • setInvisible

        public void setInvisible(boolean invisible)
        Set this shape's visibility.

        Invisible shapes won't appear on the canvas, but still exist and will interact with other shapes.

        Parameters:
        invisible - true for invisible, false for visible.

      • isInvisible

        public boolean isInvisible()
        Returns whether this shape is invisible.

        Invisible shapes won't appear on the canvas, but still exist and will interact with other shapes.

        Returns:
        true if invisible, false if visible.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Set this shape's color.
        Parameters:
        color - the color the shape will be drawn in.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Get this shape's color.
        Returns:
        the color the shape is drawn in.

      • setSolid

        public void setSolid(boolean solid)
        Set whether other shapes can overlap with this shape.

        An example of a solid shape is a wall that other shapes can't pass through.

        No shape can overlap with a solid shape. A non-solid shape can overlap with other non-solid shapes.

        Parameters:
        solid - true for a shape that can't be overlapped, false for a shape that can be.

      • isSolid

        public boolean isSolid()
        Get whether other shapes can overlap with this shape.

        An example of a solid shape is a wall that other shapes can't pass through.

        No shape can overlap with a solid shape. A non-solid shape can overlap with other non-solid shapes.

        Returns:
        true for a shape that can't be overlapped, false for a shape that can be.

      • setDirection

        public void setDirection(Direction direction)
        Set the direction this shape is facing. A shape's direction determines:
        • The orientation in which the shape is drawn.
        • The direction the shape will move in calls to move(double). (To move in other directions, see move(Direction, double)).
        • The direction the shape will move if it has a speed (see setSpeed(double)).
        If this shape's direction is set to null, it will be drawn facing to the right, and calls to move(double) will not move the shape.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction the shape will face.

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Get the direction this shape is facing. A shape's direction determines:
        • The orientation in which the shape is drawn.
        • The direction the shape will move in calls to move(double). (To move in other directions, see move(Direction, double)).
        • The direction the shape will move if it has a speed (see setSpeed(double)).
        Returns:
        the direction the shape is facing.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(double speed)
        Set the shape's speed in pixels per frame.

        This shape will automatically advance every frame in the direction set using setDirection(Direction).

        Parameters:
        speed - the number of pixels to move each frame.

      • getSpeed

        public double getSpeed()
        Get the shape's speed in pixels per frame.

        This shape automatically advances every frame in the direction set using setDirection(Direction).

        Returns:
        the number of pixels this shape moves each frame.

      • getCenter

        public Point getCenter()
        Get the location of the shape's center.
        Returns:
        a point representing the shape's center.

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(double x,
             double y)
        Changes the location of this shape.

        Note that this method will allow you to relocate this shape into a solid shape. Moving a shape into a solid shape has undefined behavior. (If you haven't called setSolid(boolean), you don't have to worry about this.) To move this shape without going through solid shapes, use move(double).

        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of this shape's new center
        y - the y-coordinate of this shape's new center

      • setCenter

        public void setCenter(Point center)
        Changes the location of this shape.

        Note that this method will allow you to relocate this shape into a solid shape. Moving a shape into a solid shape has undefined behavior. (If you haven't called setSolid(boolean), you don't have to worry about this.) To move this shape without going through solid shapes, use move(double).

        Parameters:
        center - a point representing the location of the shape's new center.

        Returns the x-value of the rightmost point in this shape.
